lead_paragraph: GROSSBERG--Joseph, died peacefully from prostate cancer on Tuesday, June 28, 2016. It was his 83rd birthday. He is survived by his beloved wife, Barbara, and son, Andrew, and leaves behind his loving brother, David, (Miriam), niece, Amy, (Alison), nephew, Robert, (Marina) and great-niece, Francesca and great-nephew, Luca. Dr. Grossberg was born in East New York, Brooklyn; the son of Russian Jewish immigrant parents who embodied the American immigrant success story. He attended City College and earned an Ed.D. from Yeshiva University. He worked as a dedicated and caring psychologist in the New York City Public High School system for thirty-one years and also maintained a private practice and earned the gratitude of many patients helped by him. Upon retirement he volunteered with the Literacy Volunteers of America and did canine therapy at a local nursing home. He enjoyed the pleasures of good books, music and cinema, especially classic films. He also learned a new language, Spanish, and enjoyed the practice of tai chi, kayaking and walking his dog. Most of all he enjoyed people. Dr. Grossberg had a gentle and kind nature and was truly a light in today's darkness. He was loved immensely by his family and friends and respected and liked by all who met him. He will be deeply missed. Services will be held on Friday, July 1st, at 10:00am at Plaza Jewish Community Chapel, 630 Amsterdam Avenue and 91st Street, NY. In lieu of flowers donations may be made to Guiding Eyes for the Blind, Yorktown Heights, NY and America's Vet Dogs, Smithtown, NY. 1/3
